description.narrative: 6.2 By 2019 communities and households have the ability to promote positive social norms to enhance child protection outcomes and prevent and respond to violence, exploitation and abuse against girls and boys (including FGM/C, TP, Child Marriage and child labour).

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 6.2 By 2019 communities and households have the ability to promote positive social norms to enhance child protection outcomes and prevent and respond to violence, exploitation and abuse against girls and boys (including FGM/C, TP, Child Marriage and child labour).

description.narrative: Support for the implementation of the National Strategy for the Reduction of Adolescent Pregnancy and Child Marriage has resulted in the development of a three-year implementation framework and a monitoring and evaluation plan to address child marriage. Formative research on social behavioural drivers for child marriage was commenced to inform development of social norms programming and to enhance Communication for Development programming and measurement on Social Norms, that will improve the ability of communities and households to promote positive social norms and prevent violence, exploitation and abuse against girls and boys. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of individuals in programme areas who regularly participate in dialogues promoting gender equitable norms including delaying child marriage
Number of communities developing and implementing plans for the reduction of harmful practices (child marriage, teenage pregnancy, FGM/C)
Number of adolescents and youths enrolled as U-reporters (disaggregated by age)
Number of advocacy events on Violence Against Children and Women supported
Country has a costed national action plan or strategy to end FGM/C being implemented

actual.value: 2019:Work commenced on an ethnographic study on FGM which will lead into the revision and adoption of the strategy in 2020.

title.narrative: # of countries (or subnational) that have a costed national strategy or action plan to eliminate child marriage

baseline.value: No national strategy or plan on child marriage and teenage pregnancy

target.value: 2019:Strategy on child marriage and teenage pregnancy resourced and implemented

title.narrative: Country implementing a costed national action plan or strategy to end child marriage.
